description: Android users have long complained that texting someone with an iPhone on iMessage is an unpleasant experience. The Justice Department argues it is also an example of anti-competitive behavior.
title: 'Green bubble shaming' at play in DOJ suit against Apple

description:
We hear the story of an Israeli man taken captive by Hamas on October 7th. He was freed by Israeli special forces 129 days later and talks about his ordeal.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
title: The Story of an Israeli Man Taken Hostage By Hamas, Now Free

description: 38-year-old Maynor Yassir Suazo Sandoval came to the U.S. to make something of himself and to help his family in Honduras. He was one the workers on the Francis Scott Key Bridge when it collapsed.
title: Families in Honduras, Mexico mourn victims of bridge collapse in Baltimore

description: Since the Francis Scott Key Bridge was struck by a cargo ship and collapsed early Tuesday. Questions continue about what's ahead.
title: Port workers in Baltimore face uncertain future

description: Among the changes, the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service will reinstate a decades-old regulation that mandates blanket protections for species newly classified as threatened.
title: Biden administration restores threatened species protections dropped by Trump

description: The polarized light image gives us a "new view of the monster lurking at the heart of the Milky Way galaxy," according to the European Southern Observatory.
title: Milky Way black hole has 'strong, twisted' magnetic field in mesmerizing new image

description: The House passed the two articles along party lines in February, but proceedings stalled amid government funding negotiations.
title: House will send impeachment articles against Mayorkas to Senate on April 10

description: Experts say it's better to set a goal you can stick to and make reading more of a community affair.
title: Here's how to set your reading goals and read more books in 2024

description: The debris that saved Rose's life in Titanic — and sparked a quarter-century of debate — fetched over $718,000 at an auction of iconic Hollywood movie props last week. It's based on a real artifact.
title: The piece of wood that saved (only) Rose in 'Titanic' was auctioned off for $718k

description: Two bodies were recovered from the Baltimore bridge collapse and investigators released a timeline of events. The Walt Disney Company and Gov. Ron DeSantis have settled their lawsuits.
title: A Baltimore bridge collapse timeline; Disney and DeSantis settle legal battle

description: After a fall near the first anniversary of her beloved aunt's death, a writer explored why grief can make us less sure-footed. She found answers, climbing a precarious staircase in Italy.
title: Can grief make us accident-prone? A writer learns how it destabilizes and remakes us

description: Experts say the Insurrection Act gives a president too much sweeping power to deploy troops on American soil without guard rails or proper oversight from Congress.
title: Legal experts worry about presidential abuse of the Insurrection Act. Here's why

description: Chevron operates a major refinery in Richmond, Calif. It also owns the city's dominant news site, putting its own spin on events, and runs similar sites in Texas and Ecuador.
title: Chevron owns this city's news site. Many stories aren't told

description: Prosecutors are asking for 40 to 50 years, citing the severity of Bankman-Fried's crimes. Lawyers of the disgraced former head of FTX are asking for far less.
title: Sam Bankman-Fried is about to get sentenced for his FTX crimes. Here's what to know

description: Kemmerer, Wyo., is on the front line of America's energy transition, with its coal plant slated to close and a nuclear plant in the works. But some think the rush to quit fossil fuels is impractical.
title: Why a town on the front line of America's energy transition isn't letting go of coal

description: Women who are pregnant or who have recently given birth in Gaza face serious challenges amid daily airstrikes, continued ground fighting, high rates of disease and a growing lack of food and water.
title: 'Struggle, struggle, struggle.' What new and expecting mothers are facing in Gaza

description: The Key Bridge collapse is upending life for countless people in the Chesapeake region. Residents say it's not just infrastructure — it's their identity as people who live close to the water.
title: For Baltimore-area residents, bridge collapse means longer commutes and uncertain prospects

description: Alexandra Tanner's debut novel, Worry, centers two sisters in their 20s struggling with the love, anxieties and truths that they hold about each other.
title: 'Worry' is a disturbing and honest picture of what it's like to be in your 20s

description: Disney and a board appointed by Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis have settled lawsuits over who controls development in the 40-square-mile district that's home to its Orlando theme parks.
title: In Florida, there's détente in the battle between Disney and Gov. Ron DeSantis

description: The deadly Francis Scott Key Bridge collapse blocked off much of Baltimore's harbor, which handles more cars and trucks than any other U.S. port. Companies have some options to keep imports coming.
title: Some foreign-made cars might be delayed as auto companies figure out port deliveries

description: A California judge found that attorney John Eastman committed "exceptionally serious ethical violations" in his efforts to overturn the results of the 2020 election and recommended disbarment.
title: California judge recommends disbarment of pro-Trump attorney John Eastman
